workflow.title: LUMA Workflow
workflow.summary: Step-by-step process for designing and validating UI scaffolds.
details: LUMA enforces a scaffold-first design workflow:
- Create UI structure as JSON scaffold (no code yet)
- Use Stack, Grid, Form, Table, Button, Field, Text nodes
- Define responsive overrides for different viewports
- Run: luma keyboard scaffold.json (check tab flow)
- Run: luma flow scaffold.json --patterns form,table (validate UX patterns)
- Only after scaffold passes, generate code
- Use scaffold as source of truth
- Do not change structure without updating scaffold
Keep scaffolds in version control alongside implementation code.

layout-solver.title: Layout Solver Algorithm
layout-solver.summary: LUMA uses a headless layout engine to compute node frames and detect layout issues.
details: The layout solver works in three stages:
1. Measure Phase: Compute intrinsic sizes for all leaf nodes (Text, Button, Field)
2. Layout Phase: Apply layout rules (Stack distributes along direction, Grid uses cells)
3. Frame Assignment: Calculate final x, y, width, height for every node
Stack layout distributes children along direction (horizontal/vertical) with gap spacing.
Grid layout uses columns/rows with cell placement and responsive breakpoints.
Box layout wraps a single child with padding.
- primary-below-fold: Primary action below viewport fold

keyboard-flow.title: Keyboard Flow Analysis
keyboard-flow.summary: Tab sequence generation and flow validation for keyboard accessibility.
details: 1. Pre-order traversal of the node tree
3. Tab sequence generation in tree order
- cancel-before-primary: Cancel/back button should not precede primary action
- field-after-actions: Fields must appear before actions in Forms
- unreachable: All focusable nodes must be in tab sequence
For Forms, expected order is Fields → Actions per GOV.UK patterns.

scoring.title: Scoring System
scoring.summary: Weighted category scoring with pass/fail criteria.
details: Custom weights can be provided via --weights JSON flag.

overrides.title: Responsive Overrides
overrides.summary: Viewport-specific property overrides for responsive design.
details: Responsive overrides allow different values at different viewport widths.
- Base properties used when no override matches
Example: Hide element on mobile, show on desktop
{ visible: false, overrides: [{ minWidth: 1024, visible: true }] }

issue-fields.title: Issue Structure
issue-fields.summary: Canonical issue format used across all LUMA outputs.
details: - nodeId: ID of the node with the issue
- error: Blocks pass criteria (MUST failures, critical flow errors)
- warn: Reduces score but doesn't block (SHOULD failures, heuristic warnings)

exit-codes.title: Exit Codes
exit-codes.summary: Standard exit codes used by all LUMA commands.
details: Malformed JSON or missing required fields

run-folders.title: Run Folders
details: LUMA writes all outputs to run folders:
- layout_<WxH>.json: Layout analysis per viewport (e.g., layout_375x667.json)
- keyboard.json: Tab sequence and flow issues
- Reproducible: All analysis outputs in one folder
- Timestamped: Easy to track runs over time
1. Run analysis commands (ingest, layout, keyboard, flow)
2. Artifacts accumulate in latest run folder

scaffold-contract.title: Scaffold Contract
scaffold-contract.summary: Deterministic rules for generating valid LUMA scaffolds.
details: You are producing a LUMA Component Scaffold JSON.
- screen.root is ONE node of type Stack|Grid|Box|Text|Button|Field|Form|Table
- Every node has: id, type (and required fields for its type)
- Table has title (non-empty), columns[] (len ≥ 1), responsive.strategy ∈ {wrap, scroll, cards}
- settings.spacingScale is an array of numbers
Output MUST be a single JSON object. No comments. No markdown.

golden-template.title: Golden Template
golden-template.summary: A pre-validated scaffold example for reference and base generation.
details: The Golden Template is a minimal, valid scaffold that passes all LUMA validations.
- Table (3 columns: Task, Status, Due Date)
- Passes: luma layout --viewports 320x640 (no overflow or below-fold issues)
- Passes: luma flow --patterns table (all MUST rules)
- A reference for valid scaffold structure
- A starting point for new scaffolds

component-text.title: Text Component
component-text.summary: Display text content with optional styling and sizing.
details: The Text component displays text content with configurable font size and layout policies.
- id (string, required): Unique identifier for the component
- fontSize (number, optional): Font size in pixels (default: 16)
- maxLines (number, optional): Maximum number of lines before truncation
- intrinsicTextWidth (number, optional): Single-line width hint for layout calculations
- minSize (object, optional): Minimum size constraint {w?: number, h?: number}
- maxSize (object, optional): Maximum size constraint {w?: number, h?: number}
- at (object, optional): Responsive overrides keyed by '<=N' or '>=N'

component-button.title: Button Component
component-button.summary: Interactive button element with optional text and role hint.
details: The Button component creates focusable interactive elements with visual role hints.
- id (string, required): Unique identifier for the component
- text (string, optional): Button label (if absent, treated as icon-only)
- focusable (boolean, optional): Whether button can receive focus (default: true)
- tabIndex (number, optional): Tab order index (non-zero values discouraged)
- minSize (object, optional): Minimum size constraint {w?: number, h?: number}
- maxSize (object, optional): Maximum size constraint {w?: number, h?: number}
- at (object, optional): Responsive overrides keyed by '<=N' or '>=N'
- Setting non-zero tabIndex (use default tab order)
- Forgetting 'text' for visible buttons (icon-only should be intentional)

component-table.title: Table Component
component-table.summary: Data table with responsive behavior and column configuration.
details: The Table component displays tabular data with configurable responsive strategies.
- id (string, required): Unique identifier for the component
- title (string, required): Table title (must be non-empty)
- columns (array, required): Array of column names as strings (length ≥ 1)
- rows (number, optional): Number of rows (density heuristic)
- responsive (object, required): Configuration with 'strategy' and optional 'minColumnWidth'
- minSize (object, optional): Minimum size constraint {w?: number, h?: number}
- maxSize (object, optional): Maximum size constraint {w?: number, h?: number}
- at (object, optional): Responsive overrides keyed by '<=N' or '>=N'
- 'wrap': Columns wrap to multiple lines on narrow viewports
- 'scroll': Table scrolls horizontally when too wide
- 'cards': Each row becomes a card on mobile
- Must be array of strings (not objects)
- Using object array for columns instead of string array
- Empty columns array (must have at least 1 column)

component-form.title: Form Component
component-form.summary: Form container with fields and action buttons.
details: The Form component organizes input fields and action buttons with state management.
- id (string, required): Unique identifier for the component
- fields (array, required): Array of Field components (length ≥ 1)
- actions (array, required): Array of Button components (length ≥ 1)
- states (array, required): Form states (must include 'default', include 'error' if any field has errorText)
- minSize (object, optional): Minimum size constraint {w?: number, h?: number}
- maxSize (object, optional): Maximum size constraint {w?: number, h?: number}
- at (object, optional): Responsive overrides keyed by '<=N' or '>=N'
- Must be array of Field objects (not simple values)
- Each field must have: id, type: 'Field', label
- Must be array of Button objects
- Typically includes submit button with roleHint: 'primary'
- Include 'error' if any field has errorText property
- Empty fields array (must have at least 1 field)
- Empty actions array (must have at least 1 button)
- Having errorText in fields but not including 'error' in states
- Using object instead of array for fields or actions

component-field.title: Field Component
component-field.summary: Form input field with label, optional type and helper/error text.
details: The Field component represents a single form input with a required label and optional validation metadata.
- required (boolean, optional): Marks field as mandatory
- helpText (string, optional): Helper guidance below field
- errorText (string, optional): Error message (include 'error' state in Form.states if used)
- minSize (object, optional): Minimum size {w?: number, h?: number}
- maxSize (object, optional): Maximum size {w?: number, h?: number}
- at (object, optional): Responsive overrides keyed by '<=N' or '>=N'
- Invalid inputType value (must be supported enum)
- Adding errorText without 'error' state in parent Form

component-box.title: Box Component
component-box.summary: Single-child container applying padding and sizing policies.
details: The Box component wraps exactly one child node providing padding and sizing constraints.
- padding (number, optional): Internal padding in pixels (default: 0)
- child (object, optional): Single child component (any node type)
- minSize (object, optional): Minimum size {w?: number, h?: number}
- maxSize (object, optional): Maximum size {w?: number, h?: number}
- at (object, optional): Responsive overrides keyed by '<=N' or '>=N'
- Using 'children' array instead of 'child' (Box only supports single child)
- Nested Box without padding (add padding or use Stack/Grid if multiple children)
- Using Box where Stack would better express multiple siblings

component-stack.title: Stack Component
component-stack.summary: Linear layout container arranging children vertically or horizontally.
details: The Stack component arranges child components in a single direction with spacing.
- id (string, required): Unique identifier for the component
- gap (number, optional): Space between children in pixels (default: 0)
- padding (number, optional): Internal padding in pixels (default: 0)
- wrap (boolean, optional): Allow wrapping (only applies to horizontal, default: false)
- children (array, required): Array of child components (any node type)
- minSize (object, optional): Minimum size constraint {w?: number, h?: number}
- maxSize (object, optional): Maximum size constraint {w?: number, h?: number}
- at (object, optional): Responsive overrides keyed by '<=N' or '>=N'
- gap: Space between children (not at edges)
- padding: Space inside the Stack around all children
- Use values from settings.spacingScale for consistency
- Empty children array (must have at least 1 child)
- Using 'wrap' with vertical direction (only works with horizontal)
- Forgetting to set gap for spacing between items

component-grid.title: Grid Component
component-grid.summary: Grid layout container with automatic responsive columns.
details: The Grid component arranges children in a multi-column grid with responsive behavior.
- id (string, required): Unique identifier for the component
- columns (number, required): Intended maximum number of columns
- gap (number, optional): Space between grid items in pixels (default: 0)
- minColWidth (number, optional): Minimum column width - allows column reduction on small viewports
- children (array, required): Array of child components (any node type)
- minSize (object, optional): Minimum size constraint {w?: number, h?: number}
- maxSize (object, optional): Maximum size constraint {w?: number, h?: number}
- at (object, optional): Responsive overrides keyed by '<=N' or '>=N'
- Grid may use fewer columns on narrow viewports if minColWidth is set
- Set minColWidth to enable automatic column reduction
- Grid calculates actual columns: floor(viewport_width / minColWidth)
- Example: 4 columns with minColWidth:150 becomes 2 columns on 320px viewport
- Space between grid items (both horizontal and vertical)
- Use values from settings.spacingScale for consistency
- Empty children array (must have at least 1 child)
- Setting columns to 0 or negative value
- Not using minColWidth for responsive behavior

snippets.title: LUMA Snippets
snippets.summary: Reusable JSON component fragments for rapid scaffold composition.
details: LUMA v1.1+ includes a snippets library for common UI patterns.
- Vertical stack container with standard 16px gap
- Use for vertical layouts, forms, content sections
- Horizontal toolbar with 8px gap and center alignment
- Use for action bars, navigation, button groups
- Complete form with name and email fields
- Ready to customize by adding/removing fields
- Data table with 3 columns and scroll strategy
- Email input field with validation and help text
- Copy snippet JSON into your scaffold
- Adjust properties (text, labels, etc.) as needed
- Combine multiple snippets to build complex UIs
- Use luma scaffold new to generate scaffolds with snippets
- Snippets follow best practices and pass validation
- Customize gap/padding values to match your design system
1. Start with stack.vertical as root container
2. Add form.basic for user input section
All snippets are located in the snippets/ directory.
See snippets/index.json for detailed metadata and examples.

scaffold-examples.title: Scaffold Examples
scaffold-examples.summary: Representative multi-screen and advanced modeling patterns.
details: This topic provides modeling patterns for real-world UI scenarios beyond single basic screens.
- Model each screen as a separate scaffold JSON (login.json, dashboard.json).
- Keep shared settings (spacingScale, breakpoints) consistent across files.
- Benefits: Smaller JSON files, focused validation, clearer diffs.
- Use component 'states' arrays (Form.states, Table.states) to express dynamic variants.
- Avoid duplicating entire nodes for simple variations (e.g., loading placeholders).
- Represent modals as Box or Stack with contextual actions and states.
- Include a 'visible' property toggled by state in parent context.
- Use multiple Form nodes or a Stack grouping step containers.
- Buttons with text 'Next', 'Previous', 'Finish' indicate Guided.Flow pattern activation.
- Avoid hiding primary action below fold (see Guided.Flow GF-SHOULD rules).
- Use Grid with minColWidth to adapt column count across breakpoints.
- Combine Text headings, Table for data, Form for filters.
login.json (Form with email/password) + dashboard.json (Grid with Table + action toolbar).
- Validate each screen separately: luma ingest login.json; luma ingest dashboard.json.
- Score only the screen under refinement to reduce noise.
- Use states when structure is identical and only content/loading differs.
- Use separate screen scaffold when layout/interaction model changes materially (e.g., overlay vs base).

pattern-usage.title: Pattern Usage
pattern-usage.summary: How patterns are selected (implicit/explicit) and recommended activation practices.
details: Patterns validate UX rules (MUST/SHOULD). Activation can be explicit or implicit.
2. Implicit (Auto-Selection): omit --patterns and LUMA infers high-confidence patterns (>=80 score).
3. Suppressed: use --no-auto to disable implicit selection.
- Multi-step indicators (Next/Previous buttons, step containers) => Guided.Flow
- Add behaviors.disclosure hints to reliably trigger Progressive.Disclosure.
- During focused refinement of a single pattern (only validate Form.Basic).
- To reduce noise by excluding unrelated patterns.
- Use: luma flow scaffold.json --coverage --json | jq '.coverage' to identify gaps.
- Running flow with only obvious patterns and missing disclosure or wizard patterns → incomplete validation.
1. Run suggestion first: luma patterns --suggest scaffold.json --json
3. Run flow with either explicit list or auto selection.
4. Review MUST failures first; then address SHOULD warnings.
- You can use short aliases: form, table, pd, guided-flow, wizard.

best-practices.title: Scaffold Best Practices
best-practices.summary: Guidelines for maintainable, high-quality scaffold JSON.
details: - One scaffold per screen or modal; avoid monolithic single-file apps.
- Keeps validation output focused and actionable.
- Copy from snippets/ then adapt IDs and labels.
- Run luma patterns --suggest before heavy editing.
- Avoid late discovery of missing Form fields or Table responsive config.
- Use settings.spacingScale values for gap/padding (prevents spacing-off-scale issues).
- Ensure minSize or default measurement keeps interactive elements >=44px in both dimensions.
- Include only meaningful states; avoid speculative placeholders.
- Use --errors-only during early iteration to focus on blockers.
- Switch to full detail before scoring.
- Keep schemaVersion constant ('1.0.0'); bump only with spec changes.
- Commit scaffold changes alongside implementation updates to prevent drift.
- After flow run, inspect coverage gaps to decide if more patterns should be activated.
- Consolidate pipeline with analyze (future) or chained commands to reuse run folder.
- Reference examples/happy-form.json and templates/golden.todo.mock.json for structure sanity checks.
- Prefer behaviors.disclosure hints over manual pattern listing; more deterministic and lower token cost.
These practices reduce validation cycles and improve clarity for both humans and AI agents.

error-glossary.title: Error Glossary
error-glossary.summary: Common issue IDs with causes and resolution strategies.
details: Cause: Field missing label property or empty string.
Fix: Add non-empty 'label' to each Field.
Cause: Form.actions array empty or missing.
Fix: Provide at least one Button (usually primary submit).
Cause: Actions listed before fields in Form definition.
Fix: Reorder fields[] before actions[] in JSON.
Fix: Adjust gaps/minSize or use scroll strategy for wide tables.
Cause: Primary action frame beyond viewport height.
Fix: Reduce vertical spacing or reposition actions higher.
Cause: Focusable node not in traversal order (hidden or misplaced).
Fix: Ensure visibility and proper tree position; avoid invisible focusable elements.
Cause: Collapsible section lacks control Button.
Fix: Add adjacent Button (text 'Show more', 'Details', etc.) or use controlsId linking.
Cause: Primary action hidden within collapsed area by default.
Fix: Keep primary action outside or defaultState 'expanded'.
Cause: Collapsible section lacks textual label heading.
Fix: Add Text node or ariaSummaryText hint.
Cause: Guided.Flow primary action below viewport fold.
Fix: Elevate action or introduce sticky action bar.
Cause: gap/padding value not in settings.spacingScale.
Cause: Interactive element smaller than minTouchTarget.
Fix: Increase minSize or text length / padding.
Cause: Node.type not one of allowed union members.
Fix: Use one of: Stack, Grid, Box, Text, Button, Field, Form, Table.
1. Fix all error severity issues first (MUST / critical).
2. Re-run ingest/layout/flow with --errors-only for quick iteration.
4. Run full pipeline without filters before scoring.
Use: luma agent --help-with=<error-id> (planned) for structured guidance.
Keep glossary updated as new patterns/rules are added.
